channel.title: Posts on Ankit
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Ankit

item.title: What is Einsum anyway?
item.description: Einstein summation lets us write an algebric expression in index-notation and have numpy/pytorch/jax generate the most effiecient set of tensor operations to compute it. The only cons is that it can be confusing and comes with a learning curve. Einsum is backend agnostic tho, i.

item.title: Musings #3
item.description: June is the most exciting month for me. Every year Apple organises its World Wide Developer Conference (WWDC) in June. I am a big Apple fan, been watching these since 2014 and now its almost 11 years and the level of excitement hasn’t changed a bit.

item.title: Musings #2
item.description: Oh man, did I skip a beat or what? I had thought that I would be regular in writing these but I have been shit lately. Let’s forget what happened and give it a fresh start. From now on, biweekly musings are going out.

item.title: Musings #1
item.description: It’s been a while since I have acquired this domain and thought about consistent writing. But, I kept procrastinating. I always felt what exactly should I write, and as I am queering my career in tech, I have plenty to express and write about now.

item.title: Create new Google Doc from the search bar
item.description: TIL, you can create new doc, sheet, slide, form, site or a calendar event from the search bar at the top of the Chrome. This is so convinient if you’re a Chrome user. Create a new Google Doc: doc.new Create a new Google Sheet: sheet.

item.title: DFS?
item.description: I have always struggled with Depth First Search, DFS. I now have started solving it using first principles and it has started to make sense. DFS can be solved using two methods: Recursive solution Iterative solution, using stacks To solve recursively we must keep few things in our mind:

item.title: How to find good research papers?
item.description: There is plethora of research happening all around us and in the recent times the incoming number of research papers have increased by quite a number. This raises a question on how to find a good paper and give it a read.

item.title: The AI Summer
item.description: Meta LLaMA, Stanford Alpaca, PaLM, OpenAI GPT-4. This week has been crazy. The previous week started with the storming LLaMA release from the Meta which advanced to weight leaks on the torrent. Then Stanford released the Alpaca model fine tuned from the LLaMA 7B model on 52K instruction-following demonstrations.

item.title: Hello, World
item.description: Hello, World #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { cout << "Hello, World!" << endl; return 0; }
